<small>Aramaic form: **<big>[[H2269|חֲבַר]]</big>**</small>
 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חָבַר‎</span>] **verb** ==unite== (usually intransitive), ==be joined, tie a magic knot or spell, charm== (Late Hebrew ***id.***; Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> yet Assyrian [<abbr title="transliteration"><u>***abâru***</u></abbr>], <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***ubburu***</u></abbr> ***bind, ban*** (of spells), <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***êbru***</u></abbr>, ***friend***, and many derivatives, [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>W 51 ff.</sup>; Aramaic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חַבֵּר‎</span> and many derivatives; compare Phoenician noun <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חבר‎</span> associate) — 

**Qal** ***Perfect*** 3 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חָֽבְרוּ‎</span> [[Gen.14.3|Gen 14:3]] ***Participle active*** masculine <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֹבֵר‎</span> [[Deut.18.11|Deut 18:11]],<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חוֺבֵר‎</span> [[Ps.58.6|Ps 58:6]] feminine plural<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֹבְרֹת‎</span> [[Exod.26.3|Exod 26:3]] (twice in verse) + 2t. + [[Ezek.1.9|Ezek 1:9]] (compare below), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חוֺבְרוֺת‎</span> [[Ezek.1.11|Ezek 1:11]] ***Passive participle*** construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֲבוּר‎</span> [[Hos.4.17|Hos 4:17]] (yet. see below); — 

**1.** ***unite, be joined:*** 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** of allies, followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶלֹֿ‎</span> location [[Gen.14.3|Gen 14:3]], construction pregnant = ***came as allies unto***; passive participle figurative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֲבוּר עֲצַבִּים אֶפְרָ֖יִם‎</span> [[Hos.4.17|Hos 4:17]] ***Ephraim is joined to idols*** (but [[BDB#We|We]] reads <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חבר‎</span>, see <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חבֵר‎</span> **2 d**, and compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֲבֵרָיו‎</span> [[Isa.44.11|Isa 44:11]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֲבֶרְתְּךָ‎</span> [[Mal.2.14|Mal 2:14]]). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** of one thing reaching to, touching another; wings of Ezekiel's living creatures followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶלֿ‎</span> of thing, [[Ezek.1.9|Ezek 1:9]] (strike out [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] [[BDB#B|B]] [[BDB#Co|Co]], but see [[BDB#Sm|Sm]]); compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אישׁ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ח‎</span>, v[[Ezek.1.11|Ezek 1:11]], i.e. ***joining each one*** (transitive), &lt; [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] [[BDB#Syr|ᵑ6]] [[BDB#Co|Co]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אשׁה‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ח‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אלאֿחותה‎</span> (as v[[Ezek.1.9|Ezek 1:9]]), ***united each to the other***; so of curtains of tabernacle, followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶלֿ‎</span> of thing [[Exod.26.3|Exod 26:3]] (twice in verse); absolute ***joined together***, of shoulderpieces of ephod [[Exod.28.7|Exod 28:7]] (all [[BDB#P|P]]; compare also **Pu\`al**). 

**2.** ***tie magic knots, charm*** ([[BDB#RS|RS]]<sup>JPh xiv. 1885,123</sup> thinks meaning ***charm*** is derived from ***nectere verba***, and compare Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, ***narrative***); only with accusative of congnate meaning with verb <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חָ֑בֶר‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ה‎</span> [[Deut.18.11|Deut 18:11]] (in a long series of kindred phrases), specifically of charming serpents [[Ps.58.6|Ps 58:6]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְלַחֲשִׁים‎</span>). **Pi\`el** ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חִבַּר‎</span> [[Exod.36.10|Exod 36:10]] 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְחִבַּרְתָּ֫‎</span> [[Exod.26.6|Exod 26:6]] + 2 t.; ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיְחַבֵּר‎</span> [[Exod.36.10|Exod 36:10]] + 2 t.; suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיְחַבְּרֵהוּ‎</span> [[2Chr.20.36|2Chr 20:36]] ***Infinitive construct*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְחַבֵּר‎</span> [[Exod.36.18|Exod 36:18]] — 

**1.** ***make an ally of unite*** one with, only <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ויחברהו עִמּוֺ‎</span> [[2Chr.20.36|2Chr 20:36]] ***and he united him with himself***, followed by Infinitive purpose. 

**2.** ***unite, join*** (transitive), only Exodus ([[BDB#P|P]]), of tabernacle, object the curtains, followed by accusative + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶלֿ‎</span> of thing [[Exod.26.6|Exod 26:6]]; [[Exod.36.10|Exod 36:10]] (twice in verse); [[Exod.36.13|Exod 36:13]]. followed by accusative only [[Exod.26.9|Exod 26:9]]; [[Exod.36.16|Exod 36:16]] object <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אתהֿאהל‎</span> ***join the tent together***, [[Exod.26.11|Exod 26:11]]; [[Exod.36.18|Exod 36:18]]. **Pu\`al** ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֻבָּ֑ר‎</span> [[Exod.39.4|Exod 39:4]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְחֻבָּ֑ר‎</span> consec [[Exod.28.7|Exod 28:7]] (but see below) 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שֶׁחֻבְּרָהֿ‎</span> [[Ps.122.3|Ps 122:3]] ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יְחֻבַּר‎</span> [[Eccl.9.4|Eccl 9:4]] [[BDB#Qr|Qr]] ([[BDB#Kt|Kt]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יבחר‎</span>see below); suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַיְחָבְרְךָ‎</span> [[Ps.94.20|Ps 94:20]] ([[BDB#Kö|Kö]]<sup>i. 257 f.</sup>; [[BDB#Ges|Ges]] [[BDB#Ew|Ew]] [[BDB#Bö|Bö]] [[BDB#De|De]] and others as **Qal**; — 

**1.a.** ***be allied with*** thee (suffix reference to <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>) [[Ps.94.20|Ps 94:20]] 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** ***be united to*** = be one of, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אל כלֿ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מי אשׁר יְח‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַחַיִּם‎</span> ***whoever is united to all the living*** ([[BDB#Kt|Kt]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יבחר‎</span> is meaningless). 

**2.** ***be joined together***, of ephod <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַלשְֿׁנֵי קְצוֺותָ֯ו ח‎</span> [[Exod.39.4|Exod 39:4]] ***by its two edges was it joined together***; compare \|\| [[Exod.28.7|Exod 28:7]] (where [[BDB#MT|ᵑ0]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶלשְֿׁנֵי קְצוֺתיו וְחֻבָּ֑ר‎</span> &lt; [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] [[BDB#Sam|⅏]] which read <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ק‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַלשֿׁ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יְחֻבָּ֑ר‎</span>); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָֿהּ‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עִיר שֶׁח‎</span> [[Ps.122.3|Ps 122:3]] ***joined together for itself*** i.e. compactly built (of Jerusalem). **Hiph\`il** ***Imperfect*** 1 singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַחְבִּ֫ירָה עליכם בְּמִלִּים‎</span> [[Job.16.4|Job 16:4]] ***I could make a joining with words*** (i.e. ***join words together*** [[BDB#RV|RV]] [[BDB#VB|VB]]) ***against you.*** **Hithpa\`el** (late) ***Perfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶתְחַבֵּר‎</span> ([[BDB#Ges|Ges]]<sup>«GKC:54»§ 54</sup> 1 n.) [[2Chr.20.35|2Chr 20:35]] ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִתְחַבָּ֑רוּ‎</span> [[Dan.11.6|Dan 11:6]] ***Infinitive*** suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִתְחַבֶּרְךָ‎</span> [[2Chr.20.37|2Chr 20:37]] Aramaic form <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הִתְחַבְּרוּת‎</span> [[Dan.11.23|Dan 11:23]] ([[BDB#Ges|Ges]]<sup>«GKC:54»§ 54</sup>, 3 R. 1) — ***join oneself to, make an alliance*** with, followed by<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עִם‎</span> person [[2Chr.20.35|2Chr 20:35]]; [[2Chr.20.37|2Chr 20:37]], followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶלֿ‎</span> person [[Dan.11.23|Dan 11:23]] reciprocal ***league together*** (absolute) [[Dan.11.6|Dan 11:6]].
